p: A number of studies concerning the cytotoxic activity of other Pistacia species have been carried out, mostly using extracts and not terpenes-rich essential oils [ 7, 32, 33, 34, 35, 36, 37, 38]. In some cases, essential oils were shown to possess cytotoxic activity on different tumor cell lines [ 36, 39]. In the present study, we first screened the cytotoxic potential of different essential oils from several species ( P. lentiscus, P. lentiscus L. var. chia, P. terebinthus, P. integerrima, and P. vera) on three human adenocarcinoma cell lines: MCF-7 (breast), 2008 (ovarian), and LoVo (colon). A multivariate analysis approach was then used to investigate the statistical correlations among the different phytocomplex components of the essential oils, allowing the identification of clusters of molecules cooperating in the cytotoxic activity.
